channel.title: [DELTA] ::Setlevel [DELTA]
channel.description: Hey, can someone send me their DELTA's Setlevel command? I tried to make one, but failed epically. =o

item.title: [DELTA] ::Setlevel [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @_jeba `jeba
item.description:
@_jeba wrote:

[quote=“de dust89, post:4, topic:336262”]Than[quote author=Oh-Noes link=topic=432641.msg3175958#msg3175958 date=1270847147]

if (command.startsWith("setlevel")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int skillID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int level = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); playerXP[skillID] = getXPForLevel(level); playerLevel[skillID] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillID]); refreshSkills(); sM("Set level to " + level + "."); } else { sM("Invalid format, use as - ::setlevel SKILLID LEVEL"); } }
Should do the trick.
[/quote]

Thanks a lot. Works perfectly. I would repp++ if I could =[[/quote]

Repped him for you.

Read full topic

item.title: [DELTA] ::Setlevel [DELTA]
item.dc:creator: @de_dust89 de dust89
item.description:
@de_dust89 wrote:

Than[quote=“Oh-Noes, post:2, topic:336262”] if (command.startsWith("setlevel")) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int skillID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int level = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); playerXP[skillID] = getXPForLevel(level); playerLevel[skillID] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillID]); refreshSkills(); sM("Set level to " + level + "."); } else { sM("Invalid format, use as - ::setlevel SKILLID LEVEL"); } }
Should do the trick.[/quote]

Thanks a lot. Works perfectly. I would repp++ if I could =[
